benchmark_details.name: EarthSE (Earth Scientific Exploration)
benchmark_details.overview: EarthSE is a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the capabilities of LLMs in Earth sciences, constructed from 100,000 research papers. It includes two QA datasets, Earth-Iron and Earth-Silver, and an open-ended dialogue dataset, Earth-Gold, covering fundamental and advanced evaluation tasks across five Earth spheres.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate the performance of LLMs in Earth science tasks, particularly their capabilities in scientific exploration and reasoning.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: No integration of the 11 tasks into a complex task chain.

data.source: Curated from 100,000 Earth science academic papers.
data.size: 100,000 papers, 4,133 QA questions in Earth-Iron, and multiple dialogue exchanges in Earth-Gold.
data.format: JSON, structured question-answer pairs, open-ended dialogue format.

methodology.calculation: Metrics like win rate are computed by comparing model outputs with reference answers based on relevance, scientific rigor, and specificity.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in retention and diversity indicate better performance and scientific exploration capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Models underperformed significantly in complex Earth science reasoning tasks.
methodology.validation: Rigorously evaluated by domain experts and through automated cleaning protocols.
